meta-viewport:
To ensure that the meta element does not disable text scaling and zooming, the following code can be used:

```
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, shrink-to-fit=no">
```

This code sets the initial scale to 1 and allows the user to zoom in and out of the page. Additionally, it ensures that the content fits within the device's screen width and does not shrink to fit.

To make the page more accessible, the following can be added:

1. Use descriptive alt text for images to provide context for users who are visually impaired or using screen readers.
2. Use semantic HTML elements to provide a clear structure for the page.
3. Ensure that all form elements have labels to make them accessible to users who rely on assistive technology.
4. Use high contrast colors for text and background to make the content easier to read.
5. Provide keyboard navigation for all interactive elements on the page to make it accessible to users who cannot use a mouse.
